definition: to fade into the distance/(fig.) to peter out/to fade away
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)

sentences.english: Walking down by the bay, on the shore, staring up at the planes that aren't there anymore.
sentences.chinese: 漫步海灣，站在岸上，凝視着天空那早已遠逝的飛機。

sentences.english: Time is the great illusion it is past or in the future.
sentences.chinese: 時間是個大幻覺，使人以爲天堂已遠逝或遙在未來。

sentences.english: I am right the clinging nebula, following its fading lights and never would I regret.
sentences.chinese: 我就是片執着的星雲，無悔的追逐它遠逝的光芒。

sentences.english: Soon, the days went far away.
I've been so blind, couldn't see for love no.
sentences.chinese: 我一直如此盲目，不能正視愛情已遠逝。

sentences.english: The light may have gone out of Heaven and meaning out of the earth.
sentences.chinese: 天堂的光芒，地球萬物存在的意義，也許早已遠逝。

sentences.english: Although in this situation, Italy has been there anymore.
